creditline: Gift of funds from Mary and Bob Mersky
description: black sedan car on a grey road next to a white wall with windows with a view of palm trees; green grass in foreground with red tulip in LRC; medium-toned circular wood frame
dimension:
8 5/8 × 8 5/8 in. (21.9 × 21.9 cm) (image, circular)
9 5/8 × 9 5/8 × 11/16 in. (24.4 × 24.4 × 1.7 cm) (outer frame, circular)
medium: Oil on biocomposite material with Masonite backing
text: Frank Walter’s giddy car careening along a palm tree-lined roadway distills the artist’s surrealist approach to the everyday, making even a clumsy, late-model vehicle seem an agent of speed and mystery.  Like a vignette within a larger narrative, this diminutive tondo—the term for such circular works of art—captures a moment of action and suspense, suggestive of a chase scene.  The viewer peers into the limits of Walter’s composition only to wonder (and perhaps worry) about the story just beyond view.
title: Untitled (Black Car)
